This is the most clever, interesting non-shooter I have ever seen. I am 7 years late finding this game, but I am mesmerized by the writing and the game play. I hate finger speed, but I dont mind a little, I love solving the puzzels. Yes, I needed the walkthrough about 8 times to get over a hump, but this is WAY worth the money. I am not real fast on this stuff, I got 24 hours of play time out of it. Cheap date in my book.

Отличный сюжет и шикарное продолжение первой части. Озвучка еще больше радует, даже в дубляже все шикарно. Также огромный плюс на функцию совместной игры с другом, которая очень интересна и притягивает внимании к игре. Отдельно можно сказать про отличную графику и новые гемплейные элементы, которых небыло в первой части.
Buy it

Having 35 hours of my life spent in Aperture Science facilities of various degree of neglect, I can proudly say that this charming game made my brain melt harder than any of my final or end-term exams I've had yet. On top of that Portal manages to deliver top-notch puns from time to time to mix with the puzzles. If you ask me, I'd say it's a must-have.

Portal 2 was the first game that actually gave me an experience worth remembering. I've played more story-driven games after it but none strikes me more profoundly than the masterpiece that is this game. Unique Gameplay, Incredible Lore/Narrative, Lovable Characters, and Immersive Graphics. Its ability to create such catharsis while being nicely wrapped in all technical aspects is what games should strive for. Simply, well executed.
Love this game so much! Masterpiece, period.

Portal 2 is the best puzzle game I have ever played and one of the best games in general.  It has a rich story, lore and great gameplay.  The puzzles are challenging on a first play though, but the game is paced and balanced that it never feels frustrating or impossible.  After playing nearly 50 hours of this game,  I can honestly rate it 10/10.  The story and gameplay never get boring or repetitive.  And for the low price, I can highly recommend it.  But maybe consider playing portal 1 first, as this game kinda spoils the ending of the first one, but it is not necessary in the slightest.
